comment: I think she's amazing. Very knowledgeable, kind, and funny, she's able to teach complex topics and make a lot of valuable connections. I found the assignments straightforward, even if nontraditional, and enjoyed in-class work. I like how transparent she is about why we do things in class, and found everything very valuable. Also gives good feedback

I take digital story telling. She does not teach how to use the programs needed to do projects in her class. She is very specific with what she wants and many parts of the projects seem unnecessary. When you ask her to make it less confusing she sometimes gets defensive or passive aggressive. The class is easy, but I'm not learning anything.

Class is easy but lots of work. You have to manage your time well if you want to succeed in class. She is a lenient grader and gives lots of time for assignments. Won't deduct late points unless it is like 2 months late. Classes are very engaging, interactive and interesting.

While I got a good grade, she wasn't the best at teaching. She gives good feedback and responds pretty fast but was fairly disorganized and when most of the class didn't write 800 words in less than a week during the busiest time in the semester, she proceeded to lecture us for almost an hour and a half, rather than letting us finish up our work.

I took Professor Haimes-Korn for American Lit and had a decent time, but when I took her for digital storytelling I did not have a great time. It's very disorganized, and it was very confusing, and the content just wasn't for me. She is incredibly nice and as a human being she's great, but her Digital Storytelling class just wasn't for me.
Rude, disorganized. Easily one of the worst professors Ive ever had.
TONS of group work, You will be reading something almost every day, 3-4 assignments a week LOTS of work for the final, so if you don't like working in groups she is not the teacher for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Loved her so much I decided to take her again! This class focuses on storytelling and the process: brainstorming, scripting/storyboarding, and collecting digital media to engage the audience. Great content creation class. Learn how to create narrative videos. Very reasonable, talk to her if you get behind. Useful for today's writ careers.

Her class simulates a real working environment, meaning: fast turnaround times, groups for pitching ideas/ editing, contacting people/ going places, and posting on multiple platforms. You are building a website/portfolio that you can show prospective employers. Stay on top of the schedule because projects do overlap. I am so proud of my work.

This course was well-organized, especially for being thrown into Covid. However, she was a complete mess. There is a lot of weekly work, but it is mostly group work. It's an easy A if you are willing to read and participate in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class was well organized. She split us into groups in the beginning and we had plenty of group discussions and projects. Weekly modules were posted weekly so you know when everything is. It's an easy A if you are on top of your agenda. She loves discussions and connecting ideas. Fun class if you have the right people. She showed us her dogs :D
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I have loved writing my entire life and this class completely ruined it for me. There is so much to do on your own time outside of this class that it's not for someone with a full-time job, or literally any other obligation. She's also quite disorganized and most lecture content comes from Wikipedia.

This prof was beyond unorganized. Coming to this class ruined my mood every single day. She will tell you to do one thing, not be very specific, and when you go online it says to do something completely different. She assigns several group projects to be done at the same time. We also had to drive somewhere for the majority of our projects

This professor is the absolute worst. I have never actually hated a professor 100%. Lemme tell y'all why. The class has no structure whatsoever. She assigns multiple projects at once, the assignment guidelines are different than what she says in class, and she randomly adds new pointless things at the last minute. You will be miserable.
literally made me miserable to take this class. tons of meaningless assignments.

AWFUL Expects so so so so much of students and is sassy constantly. One project required groups of students to drive to random peoples houses up to an hour away (using our own gas money and scheduling it around all classes and work schedules) and interview them about their dog and family. Do not take this class.... it legitimately broke my spirit
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This professor is awful. If you want an easy A with very minimal amount of work, this is your kind of class. If you ACTUALLY WANT TO TRY TO WORK FOR YOUR GRADE this isn't for you. A lot of her grades are completion grades. She assigns too much and then won't actually grade anything truthfully. I hate this professor and this super ridiculous class.

She's a tad unorganized but she's constantly working to better herself for her students, & that's really admirable. You gotta pay a good chunk of money to have a mandatory website, but it's worth it for your future portfolio. Really nice lady & will actually really miss her class.

Dr Korn has an interesting class where we read parts of many different American Literature authors. Our homework was online with summaries and group discussions. I did not think I would enjoy the class, but it turned out to be a good class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Haimes-Korn is so unorganized! Takes forever to get your grades back!! She doesn't grade tough but since it takes forever to get your grades back you're left hanging. Study for the test!! But don't bother buying the textbook- waste of money after the first 2 weeks. She also decided to "add" pop quizzes for the 2nd half of the semester- what?!

Dr. Haimes-Korn makes you work for your grade. You have a reading for every class, she splits you into teams so she doesn't have to do as much work, and there are discussions online each weekend. Her exams aren't multiple choice, but they are relatively easy and based on ppts. Pop quizzes during the second half of the semester. Don't miss class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Completely unorganized. Did not give a syllabus for 2 weeks, so you didn't know the work load until after add drop. Gave less that 48 hours to get one or two 500-word blog posts and all these modifications to this blog that we had to pay for. Refused to let us use the free version. Way too much homework and not enough time to get it done.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: My semester's work was mostly done on a blogging platform. There's pretty much daily homework, but as long as you keep up with it, it's not that bad. She really takes her time for her students, and she'll work with you as long as you get your stuff done. Definitely recommend but just be prepared to work and participate
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Haimes-Korn is  a really great instructor. She grades very fairly and does not assign too much homework. All of her assignments are meaningful and most are even enjoyable. She is a little unorganized and does not outline the assignments for the semester so it's a little difficult to plan ahead. Otherwise, she is a great teacher!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She tries to teach two classes in one. She could easily cut a lot of content. She has great ideas, but buries students in overall workload. The Reflection Papers are a waste of time. Blogs are a great idea, I've produced high quality work. She needs to do one larger, higher quality project instead of two. The deadlines make no sense for her demands

Dr. Haimes-Korn is a nice lady who makes you do a lot of work. I got an A in her class but most definitely had to work for it. It'll probably be your "hardest" class, by workload alone. Don't miss class, keep up with the assignments, participate in your group, and you will be an A or a B.

Overall, class is easy, she can be confusing on directions, and the work seems almost pointless, doesn't have a grading system, but I can't say its an easy A.  Good person, but could do better teaching, not a bad teacher at all.

She pushed the class back two weeks because she couldn't stay organized and present the info clearly. We had to print everything multiple times in addition to buying a text book that was used maybe three times. She would never grade anything until the end of the semester, making it easy to lose or forget work.

I had Physics, C++, DiffyQ, and I put more work in this class than I did all of the others combined. We had Exp. writings every day that were 700 to 800 words in length and there will be 30 of them by the end of the class(Also, two take home writings based on exps, for midterm and Final). She is Straight forward, yet be prepared to work hard.

The two people below have no idea what they are talking about. HK is a nice lady, but she gives too much unnecessary work. You will write multiple papers a week and will be forced to remember things you will never use or remember in the first place. gives a lot of filler/busy work. you have to write an analysis for everything. Useless.

ATTEND ALL CLASSES and participate - that's the point of learning; not a monologue. She is open; work with her if u're having any trouble AT ALL. Read her outline/handout for the given assignment and u will understand her intents with the hw.Things get messy quickly, but she makes more concessions for students than most teachers. Just participate!

Let me straighten the hype. If u want an EASY A, a passive or lazy class.. do us all a favor and not pick this teacher coz u will SURELY return to write curse words here. If u want to inspire urself, get ur money's worth, or learn as a scholar - U WILL LOVE&APPRECIATE THIS CLASS. Late 1-2pages paper will not lower your grade; indolence will.Capiche

She is real mean woman.She gives tons of work.Her teaching style is useless.She just likes to divide students in group so that she don't have to teach.I was really frustated with her.Never take class with her.
GOOD TEACHER.LOTS OF PAPERS AS LONG AS YOU TRY SHE WILL GIVE YOU A FAIR GRADE. FUNNY GROUP PROJECTS

She is a great professor.  Their is a lot of writing in her class but once you get used to it you can do the assignments fairly quickly.  The class is very interactive and she is willing to allow everyone to explore their thoughts on the writings.  If you want to actually advance and imporve your writing and critical thinking then take this class.

KHK is great! She really cares about your progress and if you need additional help she will work with you above and beyond your expectations. There IS a lot of work in her classes (ugh exploratory writings..) but it's really not that bad unless you procrastinate. Highly recommended! Great woman, great teacher!

I have two classes of her, rhetoric and portfolio. She's mean and not think by student's side. She is not the type helping students. She wants everyone obey her will. I've heard she discuss with Herb Smith about a guy who is "too smart" always challenge professors. They don't like this type. IMPORTANT: don't ask for recommendation letters from her.

Fantastic professor.  Take her!  You will have to write a 1-2 page Exploratory Writing twice a week, but she is worth it.  Be organized, write your EXP's, and study very little for the exams (2 - the midterm and the final) and you'll get an A.

Yes you have to write a short paper for class every day, but it just takes a few minutes of time instead of all your brain power.  Class can be enjoyable if you make her laugh with good comments.  Be organized and turn in papers to pull an A.

Somehow managed to mark me absent every day for the first 3 weeks even though I had not missed a class and only missed one homework assignment.  Even grade teachers without phd's can take attendance without screwing it up
She is very hard. Tons of work, a 1-2 page paper is due about every class. Try to find someone else

Worst teacher I've ever had. She required more work than the rest of my classes combined. We had 1-2 page papers due every class period usually about topics that just made you say "WTF?" DO NOT TAKE HER!!!

This is a great teacher if you like to write so many papers, that mean nothing by the way, to the point where your hands fall off, THEN (and only then) take her class. Really, a paper was due every day. AND THEY MEANT NOTHING.
She spends most of the time explaning your assignment rather than teaching. Do not take anything from her
evil woman told me to drop after i missed 2nd class meeting with hospital excuse and ordered to bed rest. she may compliment you, but she will say something negative at the end of the compliment.
No Comments
Great teacher, lots of work, but she is extremely helpful and fair. Class is fun and interactive.
tons of work, but very enjoyable class. great teacher all together.
Lots of work, but she's a really good teacher and the kind that you're willing to put forth the effort for. Makes the class interesting and enjoyable.
